explanation: MHD_FAVOR_SMALL_CODE: The function has two completely different bodies under #ifdef/#else. Whether large-body code (which contains many returns/continues) or the small-body wrapper is compiled determines which code is present and therefore what could be unreachable. You must know the macro's compile-time value to decide which portions of the source are actually compiled and analyzed. MHD_str_pct_decode_lenient_n_: Used in the MHD_FAVOR_SMALL_CODE branch; the wrapper-call/return pattern (and any side effects) affects reachability in the small-body variant (e.g. whether execution returns to set str[res]=0 or if that call can longjmp/abort). strlen: Used in the MHD_FAVOR_SMALL_CODE branch to compute len passed to MHD_str_pct_decode_lenient_n_. Its presence and behavior affect control flow in the small-body variant only. toxdigitvalue: Called repeatedly in the large-body (non-small) implementation to decide branches (valid hex -> decode; invalid -> copy-as-is). Understanding whether that call can return particular values (>=0 or <0) and whether it can have side effects is necessary to determine if subsequent branches/blocks are reachable. These four symbols are the minimal additional items required to decide which code is actually compiled in and whether individual branches/blocks inside the chosen body can be reached.
